channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: What Google Glass got right — and really, really wrong
item.description: Google didn't invent the concept of smart glasses, but it did help make them mainstream. In retrospect, 13 years after their launch, this is both a good and bad thing. Glass made a lot of people dream about new ways to use computers without staring down at screens all day. Glass also made a lot […]

item.title: Hémorragie chez Apple : après le chef de l’IA, le patron des puces sur le départ ?
item.description: Là, ça commence à faire beaucoup. Après le départ du chef de l'IA et du patron du design, c'est au tour de Johny Srouji de faire ses cartons ? Selon Mark Gurman, l'architecte des puces Apple Silicon envisagerait "sérieusement" de partir. Si ça se confirme, c'est le pilier technique d'Apple qui s'effondre.

item.title: « L’Union européenne devrait être abolie » : 120 millions d’euros, l’amende qui a rendu Elon Musk fou de rage contre l’Europe
item.description: La Commission européenne vient d'infliger une amende de 120 millions d'euros à X. La raison ? Ces fameuses coches bleues payantes qui trompent tout le monde et une transparence aux abonnés absents. La réaction d'Elon Musk a été… explosive.

item.title: A love letter to glory days of iPhone gaming
item.description: It may be hard to believe now, but the App Store was once a thriving place for inventive indie games. The ubiquity of the iPhone coupled with the relative ease of development for the platform meant that smaller studios were able to get their games in front of huge audiences, leading to a great time […]

item.title: The Witcher 3 director talks evolving freedom of choice in upcoming RPG The Blood of Dawnwalker – 'you can do whatever you want to do'
item.description: We sit down with The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt director Konrad Tomaszkiewicz to discuss his upcoming game The Blood of Dawnwalker.

item.title: Missing NBC on Fubo? Here's how to watch Sunday Night Football this week and more
item.description: If you're a Fubo subscriber, you've certainly noticed that NBC and all NBCUniversal-owned channels have gone dark on the platform. For over a week, customers have gone without NBC programming like the Today Show and The Voice, and for the second week in a row, customers will have to find alternate methods of watching this week's Sunday Night Football game, too. It's all because Fubo and NBCUniversal are having a contract dispute, so channels like NBC, USA Network, Telemundo, and Bravo have been unavailable on Fubo since Nov. 21, and as of now, there's no projected date for their return. A mes...

item.title: Test de l’Amazon Echo Studio 2025 : l’enceinte connectée Dolby Atmos qui veut remplacer votre barre de son… pour (presque) le prix d’une enceinte solo
item.description: L’enceinte Amazon Echo Studio 2025 est un modèle connecté « haut de gamme grand public » qui mise sur un format compact, un vrai son spatial Dolby Atmos et l’intégration profonde d’Alexa+ pour se poser comme le cœur audio et domotique d’un salon moderne. En voici notre test.

item.title: The Best Printers for Home and Office: Brother, HP, and More
item.description: It's a boring tool, but you need one. Here are the best home printers we have tested, from ink tank to lasers.

item.title: Starlink made ‘work from home’ possible from anywhere — now, I’m ready for a change
item.description: This is The Stepback, a weekly newsletter breaking down one essential story from the tech world. For more on how to work anywhere, follow Thomas Ricker. The Stepback arrives in our subscribers' inboxes at 8AM ET. Opt in for The Stepback here. How it started I've worked from home for 20 years. In that time, […]

item.title: An all-time great game makes a comeback
item.description: Hi, friends! Welcome to Installer No. 108, your guide to the best and Verge-iest stuff in the world. (If you're new here, welcome, hope your holiday shopping is going well, and also you can read all the old editions at the Installer homepage.) This week, I've been reading about Ariana Grande and pelvic floors and […]

item.title: Forget bulky backpacks, this 9L crossbody bag is my top pick for lightweight camera gear – here's why
item.description: Ulanzi's affordable 9L camera sling bag is the perfect fit for days with lightweight gear, especially for travel and street photography, and content creators.

item.title: This electrified WW2 motorbike is one of the most exciting of 2026 – here are 5 things you need to know about the Flying Flea
item.description: Royal Enfield's first stab at an electric bike is refreshingly different and packed with cutting-edge technology.

item.title: The Best Gifts for Book Lovers (2025): E-Readers, Cozy Accessories, Book Sets
item.description: Any one of these gift ideas will make your favorite bookworm very happy, from e-readers and accessories to cozy reading essentials.

item.title: La récente GoPro Lit Hero, une mini action cam avec éclairage intégré, est encore plus abordable qu’à sa sortie
item.description: GoPro a récemment lancé la version "Lit", avec un éclairage en façade, de sa caméra d'action d'entrée de gamme "Hero", dévoilée l'an dernier. Ultra légère et capable de filmer en 4K@60fps, cette GoPro Lit Hero est actuellement proposée à 249 euros au lieu de 269,99 euros chez Boulanger.
